victims.name: Albert Ojwang
victims.story: Killed in police custody between June 7 and 8, 2025, in Nairobi after being arrested for criticizing a senior police official. His death sparked widespread outrage and protests.

victims.name: Rex Masai
victims.story: Shot in the thigh by police on June 20, 2024, in Nairobi’s city center during anti-Finance Bill protests, becoming the first casualty. He died from excessive bleeding, as confirmed by his postmortem report.

victims.name: Abdi Kadir
victims.story: A finance student shot by police during the June 2024 protests in Nairobi, left paralyzed, and died on July 16, 2024, at Kenyatta National Hospital.

victims.name: Evans Kiratu
victims.story: A plumber killed on June 22, 2024, in Nairobi after being struck by a teargas canister, causing severe groin injuries.

victims.name: Eric Shieni
victims.story: A finance student at the University of Nairobi, set to graduate in September 2024, died on June 25, 2024, from a gunshot to the head outside Parliament.

victims.name: David Chege
victims.story: A computer science graduate and freelance IT professional, died outside Parliament on June 25, 2024, during the Nairobi protests.

victims.name: Beasley Kamau
victims.story: Went missing after protests in Nairobi, found dead on June 26, 2024, at Nairobi Funeral Home with head and chest injuries from blunt force trauma.

victims.name: Ibrahim Kamau Wanjiku
victims.story: A school leaver and boda boda rider, killed by two gunshots to the neck during the June 2024 protests in Nairobi, aspiring to study electrical work.

victims.name: Erickson Kyalo
victims.story: An eatery operator in Nairobi’s Eastlands, shot dead outside Parliament on June 25, 2024, from a gunshot wound causing excessive bleeding and chest injuries.

victims.name: Wilson Sitati
victims.story: An electrical engineering student, died on his birthday, June 25, 2024, in Nairobi from blunt force trauma to the chest and neck while collecting a parcel.

victims.name: Dan Kakai
victims.story: A Form Two student at St Veronica Siritanyi High School, shot in Bungoma on June 25, 2024, while heading for a haircut, succumbing to stomach bullet wounds.

victims.name: Kelvin Odhiambo Maina
victims.story: Found dead in Nairobi’s city center on June 25, 2024, with severe head injuries from blunt force trauma during the protests.

victims.name: Kenneth Njeru Mwangi
victims.story: Died in Nairobi’s city center on June 25, 2024, from multiple injuries suspected to be from blunt force trauma during the protests.

victims.name: Kevin Andrew Mwawasi
victims.story: Found dead at a Githurai bus stop on June 26, 2024, with fatal head injuries from a gunshot during the protests.

victims.name: Kennedy Onyango
victims.story: Killed in Rongai on June 25, 2024, after being shot while buying an exercise book, ambushed by police from his hiding place.

victims.name: Emmanuel Tata
victims.story: Died in Mombasa on June 25, 2024, after being struck by teargas, becoming unconscious and passing away after transfer from Al Farooq Hospital.

victims.name: Gredo Oyaro
victims.story: Shot in the head by police in Eldoret on June 25, 2024, and died while receiving treatment at Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital.

victims.name: Chris Gitonga
victims.story: Killed by police in Nairobi on June 26, 2024, during the anti-Finance Bill protests. Age unknown.

events.title: Start of Protests
events.description: Protests begin across Kenya in response to the Finance Bill 2024, driven by youth using social media to mobilize against proposed tax increases.

events.title: First Nationwide Protest
events.description: Nationwide protests erupt against tax hikes, with clashes in Nairobi, Kisumu, and other cities. Rex Masai becomes the first casualty, shot by police in Nairobi.

events.title: Parliament Breach
events.description: Protesters storm the Parliament building in Nairobi after the Finance Bill is passed, met with live ammunition from police, resulting in multiple casualties.

events.title: Bill Withdrawal
events.description: President Ruto withdraws the Finance Bill 2024 following widespread unrest and international pressure.

events.title: International Condemnation
events.description: Global human rights groups condemn the Kenyan government’s use of excessive force against protesters.

events.title: 82 Abductions Reported
events.description: The Kenya National Commission on Human Rights (KNCHR) reports at least 82 protest-related abductions, raising concerns over state-sponsored violence.

events.title: Youth-Led Memorial Rallies
events.description: Youth groups organize peaceful memorial rallies across Kenya to honor those who lost their lives during the protests.
